com.ibm.opencard.signature
Class MFCSignatureParameter

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.ibm.opencard.service.MFCCardServiceParameter
        |
        +--com.ibm.opencard.signature.MFCSignatureParameter
public class MFCSignatureParameter
extends MFCCardServiceParameter

Encapsulation of the constructor arguments of MFCSignatureService. The number of arguments to a card service is rather high. To simplify the construction, this object encapsulates all parameters required for the Signature service, except an optional pre-allocated channel. Every parameter can be set explicitly by a method invocation. Access to the parameters stored is provided only within this package.
The file access card service MFCSignatureService is derived from the generic card service MFCCardService. Consequently, the parameters are derived from the generic parameters, which are still required to invoke the base class constructor.

See Also:
MFCSignatureService, MFCCardServiceParameter

Constructor Detail

MFCSignatureParameter

public MFCSignatureParameter()
Creates new parameters, initialized with null. All parameters required for instantiating a MFCSignatureService, including those for the base class, must be set explicitly afterwards.
See Also:
MFCSignatureService

MFCSignatureParameter

public MFCSignatureParameter(opencard.core.service.CardServiceScheduler scheduler,
                             opencard.core.service.SmartCard smartcard,
                             boolean blocking)
Creates new parameters, the standard ones already set. In the first version of OCF, all card services had the same constructor arguments. This constructor expects exactly those arguments, and stores them. The remaining arguments required for instantiating a MFCSignatureService, including those for the base class, have to be set explicitly afterwards.
Parameters:
scheduler - where to allocate channels
smartcard - the smartcard to contact
See Also:
MFCSignatureService, MFCCardServiceParameter

This method was created in VisualAge.
Parameters:
newValue - com.ibm.opencard.signature.MFCKeyInfoRParser

setSignatureImpl

public final void setSignatureImpl(MFCSignatureImpl sigimpl)
Sets the signature service implementation to use. All signature services for a specific card OS version share a single signature service implementation, which is responsible for creating commands and interpreting the smartcard's responses.
Parameters:
sigimpl - the signature implementation to use
